sentences: St. Cyr was born in New Orleans, Louisiana, United States.
He played for several leading New Orleans bands before moving to Chicago in 1923.
During the 1950s, he performed and led a group named Johnny St. Cyr and His Hot Five and recorded with Paul Barbarin and George Lewis.
From 1961 until his death in 1966, St. Cyr was the bandleader of the Young Men from New Orleans, who performed at Disneyland.
He died in Los Angeles, California, and is buried in Evergreen Cemetery, in Los Angeles.
